It is my intention to hold a meeting of the complete
board four times in the course of a year* This should be in January
(probably in How York or Washington), in April (at Columbus), ana in
July (at Urbana). The XOurth meeting will take place this year in
ovamber in Minneapolis*
In the interim months, there will be a monthly meeting
of the Steering Committee, which x designated as being the cfficers
including Schooley, Paulu, Ausraus, you and myself* These meetings
an take place either in Urbana or New York* You will recall that
the Board voted this Steering Committee full authority to, carry on
the business of the Kellogg Grant, subject to ratification of the
complete Board*
I also indicated that It would be desirable to have a
weekly telephone conference between Urbana and New York, and including,
if need be, Ansa, and possible, the University of Alabama. If the
Kellogg Grant cannot defray the cost of these meetings, then I am not
certain that the Grant can do the job it was designed to do*
Our major problem, as always, has been one of an exchange
of information and of communication* What I have suggested is logical
on all points, and if there should bo an expression of criticism, I am
prepared to discuss this matter with anyone*
